Title: parseReadableSizeOrZero
Description: Given a string containing a byte size and B, KiB, KB, MiB, MB, etc. as a unit (i.e. ISO/IEC 80000-13 or decimal byte unit), this function returns the corresponding number of bytes. If the function is unable to parse the input value, it returns 0.
The inverse operations of this function are formatReadableSize and formatReadableDecimalSize.
x : Readable size with ISO/IEC 80000-13  or decimal byte unit  (String).
Number of bytes, rounded up to the nearest integer, or 0 if unable to parse the input (UInt64).
Examples: SELECT    arrayJoin(['1 B', '1 KiB', '3 MB', '5.314 KiB', 'invalid']) AS readable_sizes,      parseReadableSizeOrZero(readable_sizes) AS sizes;
